item.title: Add Google Plus and Instagram Login with Omniauth + Devise on Rails5
item.description: This post shows how to implement google plus and instagram login with omniauth and devise on rails5. This change totally depends on my previous implementation for facebook and twitter, so if you are new to implement this, you should look at those posts first. I write about google plus first, then add instagram login later. Implement Google Plus Login 0. Get Google APP ID and SECRET You can get CLIENT ID and CLIENT_SECRET from here.

item.title: Add twitter login with Omniauth + Devise on Rails5

item.title: How to use Omniauth + Devise on Rails5 from scratch
item.description: This post is no-brainer step by step memo to use omniauth and devise on rails5 for setting up oauth webapp with facebook. Rails 5.0.0.1, ruby 2.3.0, devise 4.2.0, omniauth 1.3.1, omniauth-facebook 4.0.0 are used. 0. env & requiement $ ruby -v ruby 2.3.0p0 (2015-12-25 revision 53290) [x86_64-darwin15] $ rails -v Rails 5.0.0.1 Obtain facebook AppID and AppSecret from https://developers.facebook.com/ 1. initial steps create rails app $ rails new omniauth && cd omniauth modify Gemfile and add devise and omniauth
